summary: This is a Department of Justice Office of the Inspector General memorandum documenting a voluntary interview conducted on September 1, 2021, with a Federal Bureau of Prisons Lieutenant from the Metropolitan Correctional Center New York. The interview is part of the OIG's investigation into the death of inmate Jeffrey Epstein on August 10, 2019. The memorandum lists attachments including the interview transcript and related prison records.

connections.description: The Lieutenant was a staff member assigned to the Special Housing Unit where Epstein was housed at MCC New York on August 9, 2019, the day before Epstein's death.
The Senior Special Agent conducted a voluntary interview of the Lieutenant on September 1, 2021, as part of the OIG investigation into Epstein's death.

events.title: Lieutenant's shift before Epstein's death
events.description: The BOP Lieutenant was assigned to the MCC New York Special Housing Unit, where Jeffrey Epstein was housed, the day before Epstein was found unresponsive.

events.title: Jeffrey Epstein found unresponsive
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein was found unresponsive in his cell at the Metropolitan Correctional Center New York, leading to his death.

events.title: OIG interview of BOP Lieutenant
events.description: The DOJ Office of the Inspector General conducted a voluntary, recorded interview of the BOP Lieutenant regarding the circumstances surrounding Epstein's death.

events.title: Lieutenant's memorandum
events.description: The BOP Lieutenant wrote a memorandum, which is included as an attachment to the OIG investigation report.

locations: Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York, New York
MCC New York Special Housing Unit
keyFacts: The DOJ OIG conducted a voluntary interview of a BOP Lieutenant from MCC New York on September 1, 2021, as part of its investigation into Jeffrey Epstein's death.
The Lieutenant was assigned to the MCC New York Special Housing Unit on August 9, 2019, the day before Epstein was found unresponsive in his cell.
The interview was recorded and transcribed, and the memorandum includes several attachments such as prison rosters, logs, emails, and the Lieutenant's own memorandum from August 12, 2019.
The document is an internal OIG memorandum containing neither recommendations nor conclusions, and is restricted from distribution outside the receiving agency.
